data.name: Deadlock Detection
data.description:
Implement a new mutex class `DebugMutex` with the following two main metods:

- `lock`: if a mutex is not acquired by anybody, acquire it; otherwise, wait until it is released by the current owner
- `unlock`: release a mutex acquired by this thread; if some oter thread is waiting for it, let that thread acquire it

`DebugMutex` should detect "simple deadlock" conditions. A "simple deadlock" is the following sequence:

- Thread1 acquires Mutex1
- Thread2 acquires Mutex2
- Thread1 waits on Mutex2
- Thread2 waits on Mutex1 -- *oops, they will never wake up, as they wait for each other*

In case when a "simple deadock" is detected, `DeadlockError` should be raised. `DeadlockError` should have the following attributes:

- `threads`: array of Thread objects: the 2 threads participating in the deadlock
- `mutexes`: array of DebugMutex objects: the 2 mutexes participating in the deadlock

Below is an illustration of the expected behavior:
```
mx1 = DebugMutex.new
mx2 = DebugMutex.new

mx1.lock
thread2 = Thread.new do
  mx2.lock
  mx1.lock
end
sleep 0.1

begin
  mx2.lock # should raise DeadlockError
rescue DeadlockError => e
  e.threads # => [Thread.current,thread2] in any order
  e.mutexes # => [mx1,mx2] in any order
end

```
